latestAction.text: Rules Committee Resolution H. Res. 399 Reported to House. Rule provides for consideration of H.J. Res. 79 with 1 hour of general debate. Previous question shall be considered as ordered without intervening motions except motion to recommit with or without instructions. Measure will be considered read. Bill is closed to amendments. The amendment printed in the report of the Committee on Rules shall be considered as adopted.

item.text: Pursuant to the provisions of H. Res. 405, H. Res. 399 is laid on the table.
Placed on the House Calendar, Calendar No. 72.
The amendment printed in the report of the Committee on Rules shall be considered as adopted.
The House Committee on Rules reported an original measure, H. Rept. 112-207, by Mr. Woodall.
The House Committee on Rules reported an original measure, H. Rept. 112-207, by Mr. Woodall.

summary.text: Sets forth the rule for consideration of the joint resolution (H.J. Res. 79) making continuing appropriations for fiscal year 2012.

bill.title: Providing for consideration of the joint resolution (H.J. Res. 79) making continuing appropriations for fiscal year 2012, and for other purposes.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
